…and (2) one motion to       recommit.

Mr. JACK. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…the President on       April 2, 2025.

Ms. FOXX. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.

During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.

Ms. FOXX.

Ms. FOXX.…

…581 shall be       laid on the table.

Ms. FOXX. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…and (2) one motion to recommit.

Sec. 5.

Mr. ROY. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…designees; and (2) one motion to recommit.

Mr. GRIFFITH. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…intervening motion.

Mrs. FISCHBACH. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the ranking member, the gentleman from  Massachusetts (Mr. McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as  I may consume. During consideration of this resolution, all time  yielded is for the purpose of debate only.…

…on July 30, 2025.

Mr. LANGWORTHY. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the distinguished gentleman from  Massachusetts (Mr. McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as  I may consume. During consideration of this resolution, all time  yielded is for the purpose of debate only.…

…the question       of its adoption.

Mrs. HOUCHIN. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…I yield back the  balance of my time.

Ms. FOXX. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.

Mr. Speaker, during consideration of this resolution, all time  yielded is for the purpose of debate only.…

…Resolution 164 is laid on the table.

Ms. FOXX. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.

During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…have concurred in the Senate amendment.

Ms. FOXX. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.

During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…Indiana is recognized for 1 hour.

Mrs. HOUCHIN. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…Resolution 598 is laid on the table.

Mr. GRIFFITH. Mr. Speaker, for the purposes of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.

During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…House Resolution 492 is hereby adopted.

Ms. FOXX. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield the  customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.

During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…

…may deem explanatory of H.R. 6938.

Mrs. HOUCHIN. Mr. Speaker, for the purpose of debate only, I yield  the customary 30 minutes to the gentleman from Massachusetts (Mr.  McGovern), pending which I yield myself such time as I may consume.  During consideration of this resolution, all time yielded is for the  purpose of debate only.…
